definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: This will be a whole new experience for you, the perpetual-motion machine.
sentences.chinese: 對你這臺永動機來說，這將是一全新的體驗。

sentences.english: And an unrealistic goal like inventing a perpetual motion machine is absolutely meaningless.
sentences.chinese: 而像“發明永動機”這樣不切實際的目標則毫無意義。

sentences.english: The oldest, most common design for a perpetual motion device is the overbalanced wheel.
sentences.chinese: 最古老，最普遍的永動機是失衡的輪子。

sentences.english: A perpetual motion machine would have to be frictionless.
sentences.chinese: 永動機只能是一種無摩擦力的機器。

sentences.english: His scheme for building a perpetual-motion machine is just a pipe dream.
sentences.chinese: 建造永動機計劃只是空想罷了。

sentences.english: A perpetual wealth machine is just as impossible as a perpetual motion machine.
sentences.chinese: 永遠創造財富的機制像永動機一樣是不可能存在的。

sentences.english: It's a $500 billion perpetual motion machine.
sentences.chinese: 這一臺永動機花費五千億美元。
